org.spongepowered.api.text.message

Interface Message

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Message.Score, Message.Selector, Message.Text, Message.Translatable

    public interface Message
    Represents an immutable instance of formatted text that can be displayed on the client. Each instance consists of content and a list of children messages appended after the content of this message. The content of the message is available through one of the subinterfaces.

    Messages are primarily used for sending formatted chat messages to players, but also in other places like books or signs.

    Message instances can be created using the MessageBuilder available through one of the Messages.builder() methods.

    See Also:
    Messages.builder(), Message.Text, Message.Translatable, Message.Selector, Message.Score

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Message.Score
      Represents a Message displaying the current player's score in an objective.
      static interface  Message.Selector
      Represents a Message containing a selector that will be replaced by the names of the matching entities on the client.
      static interface  Message.Text
      Represents a Message containing a plain text String.
      static interface  Message.Translatable
      Represents a Message containing a Translation identifier that gets translated into the current locale on the client.

      • getContent

        Returns the content of this Message.
        Returns:
        The content of this message

        Returns the color of this Message.
        Returns:

      • getStyle

        TextStyle getStyle()
        Returns the style of this Message. This will return a compound TextStyle if multiple different styles have been set.
        Returns:
        The style of this message

      • getChildren

        java.util.List<Message> getChildren()
        Returns the list of children appended after the content of this Message.
        Returns:
        The list of children

      • withChildren

        java.lang.Iterable<Message> withChildren()
        Returns an Iterable over this message and all of its children. This is recursive, the children of the children will be also included.
        Returns:
        An iterable over this message and the children messages

      • getClickAction

        com.google.common.base.Optional<ClickAction<?>> getClickAction()
        Returns the ClickAction executed on the client when this Message gets clicked.
        Returns:
        The click action of this message, or Optional.absent() if not set

      • getHoverAction

        com.google.common.base.Optional<HoverAction<?>> getHoverAction()
        Returns the HoverAction executed on the client when this Message gets hovered.
        Returns:
        The hover action of this message, or Optional.absent() if not set

      • getShiftClickAction

        com.google.common.base.Optional<ShiftClickAction<?>> getShiftClickAction()
        Returns the ShiftClickAction executed on the client when this Message gets shift-clicked.
        Returns:
        The shift-click action of this message, or Optional.absent() if not set

      • builder

        MessageBuilder builder()
        Returns a new MessageBuilder with the content of this message. This can be used to edit an immutable Message instance.
        Returns:
        A new message builder with the content of this message

      • toLegacy

        @Deprecated
java.lang.String toLegacy()
        Deprecated. Legacy formatting codes are being phased out of Minecraft
        Returns a representation of this Message using the legacy color codes.
        Returns:
        This message converted to the old color codes

      • toLegacy

        @Deprecated
java.lang.String toLegacy(char code)
        Deprecated. Legacy formatting codes are being phased out of Minecraft
        Returns a representation of this Message using the legacy color codes.
        Parameters:
        code - The legacy char to use for the message
        Returns:
        This message converted to the old color codes
